discourse_list.title: SES Weekly Status Update: Lending Oversight Core Unit Incubation Announcement

content.content: 960×540 395 KB   This Week’s Topic: Lending Oversight Core Unit Incubation Announcement  Join us here! on 2022-03-04T15:30:00Z  This Friday, MakerDAO SES will introduce the proposed Lending Oversight Core Unit (LOVE-001) to the community. This Core Unit is an integral part of the Real-world Asset restructuring initiative MakerDAO SES is undertaking. Led by facilitator candidate Luca Prosperi @luca_pro, the proposed Lending Oversight Core Unit will present their mission and vision of how MakerDAO could onboarding tens of billions of complex assets that have real use cases beyond trading. By adding a little LOVE, Luca and his team envision a path for MakerDAO to become the central pillar of the DeFi monetary ecosystem, with diligent credit quality reviews, deal structuring, and risk management. Join us 2022-03-04T15:30:00Z to meet the team and have your questions answered during this Friday’s status update. Add the SES Status Update Call to your calendar  Links  Discord Drive Notion   @ses-core-unit
Thanks for the presentation. The questions and answers were very informative as well.
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

discourse_list.title: SES Incubation Announcement: Legal and Transaction Services Core Unit (LTS)

content.content: Introducing the Legal and Transaction Services Core Unit The Maker community wants to scale the onboarding of real-world assets into Maker vaults to launch the protocol towards its higher potential. MakerDAO requires independent, high-quality, innovative, and results-oriented legal and transaction management skills to achieve that objective at any speed. During March 18th’s SES Weekly Status Update Call, Christian Petersen @christiancdpetersen introduced a solution for this skills gap: the Legal & Transaction Services Core Unit (LTS-001).  Mission This Core Unit aims to establish and maintain an independent network of legal professionals to support MakerDAO’s Core Units engaged in real-world financing transactions or investments. Core Units engaging in work with RWAs and structured finance will share everyday complexities involving agreements with counterparties, structured finance terms, project finance terms, physical assets, diverse jurisdictions, and regulations (to name a few).  Service Focused Don’t lawyers just block work from getting done? No, experienced and high-quality transaction lawyers facilitate the deal getting done. These skills are a fundamental prerequisite for the on-boarding of real-world assets for any asset type, from any jurisdiction, and through any strategic model. In real-world financings, transaction lawyers:  Identify and find solutions with commercial, risk, and technical teams to mitigate various commercial, legal, technical and other risks. Drive and manage deals towards closure. Communicate with relevant stakeholders. Manage and supervise external counsel. Generally, support the financing process.   1600×579 155 KB  LTS Lawyers will have similar roles for support opportunities that come to the DAO:  Undertake transaction due diligence involving the legal structure of entities, counterparties, and fiat/Dai flows. Legal research of applicable law requirements and obtain local counsel advice as needed. Negotiate commercial and legal positions, implementing the DAO’s legal risk appetite. Review borrower-provided lending documents, supporting the process through closing and disbursement. Coordinate cross Core Unit initiatives to solve multidisciplinary challenges. Perform transaction management by preparing and negotiating the term sheet, financing agreements, and ultimately coordinating transaction scheduling. Perform post-closing transaction management, providing administration of events during the deal’s life. Provide transparent and open communications with all stakeholders and the MakerDAO community.   Facilitator Focus Driving the initiative to bring legal and transaction management skills to the DAO is proposed facilitator Christian Petersen @christiancdpetersen. Christian has supported MakerDAO’s real-world finance Core Unit for the last 12 months and understands Maker’s financing challenges on each deal. In addition to his time at Maker, Christian’s experiences in the legal profession include:  Executing transactions in over 40 countries over 25 years. 15 years of private practice at international law firms and 10 years in-house Leading legal for the $16B Mozambique LNG project financing involving multiple export credit agencies, international commercial banks, and the African Development Bank. Leading legal for multiple multi-billion dollar LNG sale and purchase agreements for Mozambique LNG with buyers from Japan, China, Taiwan, India, France, the UK, and the Netherlands.  Christian’s first-hand understanding of the roles played by various groups in a transaction supports developing a competent legal services Core Unit and a Core Unit that promotes and protects Maker’s values. As such, LTS commits to:  Actively promote and abide by Maker DAO’s radical transparency and openness promise. Measure accomplishment by meaningful and measurable collaboration with the Maker community, Core Units, and potential real-world users of the real-world asset program. Import the best international standards to Maker’s real-world financing Aggressively merge TradFi and DeFi for the benefit of Maker and real-world finance. Demonstrate servant leadership.   Supporting Onboarding RWAs LTS’s incubation announcement is the second of a three-part approach to restructuring MakerDAO’s real-world lending activities for a sustainable and scalable future. More content is available on LTS and the larger initiative below:  Christian’s recorded presentation on the proposed Lending and Transaction Services Core Unit is available to explore the team’s mission and vision in greater detail. Opportunities to talk with Christian and the entire Real-world Assets team are possible during RWA Office Hours, Wednesdays at 17:00 UTC. Learn more about the Lending Oversight Core Unit (LOVE) and the collective Core Unit effort to onboard RWAs.

discourse_list.title: SES Weekly Status Update: Legal & Transaction Services Core Unit Incubation Announcement

content.content: SES Weekly Status Update: Legal & Transaction Services Core Unit Incubation Announcement  960×540 250 KB   This Week’s Topic: Legal & Transaction Services Core Unit Overview  Join us here! on 2022-03-18T15:30:00Z  This Friday, MakerDAO SES will introduce the proposed Legal & Transaction Services Core Unit (LTS) to the community. This proposed Core Unit is an integral part of the Real-world Asset restructuring initiative MakerDAO SES is undertaking. Lead by facilitator candidate Christian Petersen @christiancdpetersen, the proposed LTS Core Unit will present their mission and vision of a Core Unit dedicated to supporting the legal aspects of lending and transactions, involving no-crypto assets, within the real world. As a global and borderless finance platform, MakerDAO faces many challenges ranging from navigating various jurisdictions, non-homogenous contracts, and the unknowns of breaking ground into bridging real-world and blockchain activities. Join us 2022-03-18T15:30:00Z to explore the strategy LTS is deploying to solves these challenges, and have your questions answered during this Friday’s status update. Add the SES Status Update Call to your calendar  With the Community - Focus On Double Feature!  960×540 31.8 KB   22.03 Focus On #7: RWA Lending Principles Add to your calendar!  23.03 Focus On #8: stkMKR: Staking & Tokenomics Revision Add to your calendar!  Links  Discord Drive Notion   @ses-core-unit
